title: Pilot
description: Mork is sent to Earth to explore its traditions and, along the way meets Mindy.

title: Mork Moves In
description: Mindy lets Mork move into her apartment, much to the dispute of her father.

title: Mork Runs Away
description: Mork runs away from home after he ruins Mindy's date.

title: Mork in Love
description: Mork falls in love with a music store mannequin; Fred plans to buy a luxury car to take to his class reunion.

title: Mork's Seduction
description: Mindy's snobby friend Susan tries to steal Mork away.

title: Mork Goes Public
description: When a reporter offers a reward for proof of alien life, Mork decides to turn himself in to pay back the McConnells.

title: To Tell the Truth
description: Mindy instructs Mork not to tell lies. Meanwhile, the grouchy landlord of the music shop drops in... and drops dead.

title: Mork the Gullible
description: Mork is jailed for freeing an escaped convict who's captured at the music store. Meanwhile, Exidor begins worshiping O.J. Simpson.

title: A Mommy for Morky
description: Mindy reconnects with an ex boyfriend who's intent on marriage. Meanwhile Mork uses his age machine to revert to childhood.

title: Mork's Greatest Hits
description: A womanizing bully vows revenge after Mork embarrasses him in public.

title: Old Fears
description: Cora's depressed after the death of a friend, so Mork ages himself to cheer her up.

title: Mork's First Christmas
description: Mork can't afford to buy Christmas presents, so he makes strange, unique gifts for each of his closest friends.

title: Mork and the Immigrant
description: Mork meets Sergei, a Russian immigrant, and invites him to live with them. After Sergei refers to himself as 'an alien,' Mork becomes convinced that he himself has to register with the government as an alien.

title: Mork the Tolerant
description: Mork goes out of his way to be nice to his grouchy new neighbor, Mr. Bickley.

title: Young Love
description: Mork agrees to perform a wedding ceremony for runaway Eugene and his new girlfriend.

title: Skyflakes Keep Falling on My Head
description: Exidor loans Mork and Mindy his decrepit cabin in the woods. Meanwhile, Exidor plans to become a rock star so he can obtain the title Emperor of Earth.

title: Mork Goes Erk
description: Mork decides to leave the planet. Meanwhile, Susan convinces Mork, Mindy and Mr. Bickley to see a lecherous motivational speaker.

title: Yes Sir, That's My Baby
description: When a kidnapper solicits Mork to buy a baby, the police ask Mindy to help catch the criminal.

title: Mork's Mixed Emotions
description: Mork's attempt to lock up his emotions backfires and each of his emotions boil to the surface.

title: Mork's Night Out
description: While Mindy's out of town, Mork drags Mr. Bickley to a single's bar where they meet a nefarious mother and daughter.

title: In Mork We Trust
description: Mr. Bickley begins stealing things from Mork and Mindy -- including Mork's age machine.

title: Mork Runs Down
description: On Mork's birthday, he gets so run down that he forgets he has to recharge his body with an egg-like Gleek.

title: It's a Wonderful Mork
description: After ruining Fred and Mindy's night, Mork decides he wants to go back to Ork, so Orson shows him what the McConnells' lives would have been like if Mork had never arrived on Earth.

title: Mork's Best Friend
description: Mork gets a pet caterpillar; Exidor begins preaching about reincarnation.

title: Mork in Wonderland: Part 1
description: After taking cold medicine, Mork begins to shrink.

title: Mork in Wonderland: Part 2
description: Mork winds up in a parallel universe where Exidor has become a tyrannical king.

title: Stark Raving Mork
description: Mork foolishly picks a fight with Mindy in order to "kiss and make up."

title: Mork's Baby Blues
description: Kathy drags Mork home for an evening and later announces that she's pregnant with his child.

title: Dr. Morkenstein
description: Mork instills human emotions in a robot.

title: Mork vs. Mindy
description: Mork and Mindy compete to earn a job working for Nelson.

title: Mork Gets Mindy-itis
description: As Mindy prepares a formal party for Nelson, Mork discovers he's become allergic to Mindy.

title: A Morkville Horror
description: When Mindy's childhood home is put up for sale, Mork discovers several of Mindy's deceased relatives still reside there.

title: Mork's Health Hints
description: Mindy goes to the hospital to have her tonsils removed, but a mix-up finds her being prepped for brain surgery.

title: Dial 'N' for Nelson
description: Nelson gets threatening phone calls after he makes a stand against strip joints, so Mork and Mindy decide to sneak into one to investigate.

title: Mork vs. the Necrotons: Part 1
description: Three voluptuous aliens from Necroton capture Mork and attempt to find out what information he's learned about Earth.

title: Mork vs. the Necrotons: Part 2
description: Captain Nirvana kidnaps Mindy in order to coax Mork out of hiding.

title: Hold That Mork
description: Nelson tries to further his political career by getting Mork the opportunity to try out to be a Denver Broncos cheerleader.

title: The Exidor Affair
description: Mindy's level of annoyance with Exidor hits an all-time high when he invites himself and his new girlfriend, Ambrosia, to dinner.

title: The Mork Syndrome
description: When Mork decides to join the air force, he unwittingly learns of the cover up of a radiation spill.

title: Exidor's Wedding
description: Mork finds Exidor's estranged mother who protests his forthcoming marriage to Ambrosia by chaining herself to Mindy's kitchen counter.

title: A Mommy for Mindy
description: Mork is overjoyed when Fred returns and announces that he's remarried, but for Mindy, it dredges up painful memories of her mother's death.

title: The Night They Raided Mind-ski's
description: Mork haplessly gets involved with a group of white supremacists.

title: Mork Learns to See
description: When Mr. Bickley's blind son comes to town, he gets dumped on Mork and Mindy.

title: Mork's Vacation
description: When Mork takes a mental vacation, other strange, vacationing aliens take up residence in his body. Meanwhile Jean and Remo's mother visits Boulder.

title: Jeanie Loves Mork
description: Mindy takes a job writing the Miss Lonely Hearts newspaper column and unknowingly encourages Jean to pursue a romantic relationship with Mork.

title: Little Orphan Morkie
description: When Mork is threatened with deportation, Exidor adopts him.

title: Looney Tunes and Morkie Melodies
description: Nelson is given TV air time to plug his political views on a Saturday morning, so Mork uses the opportunity to put on a kiddie show.

title: Clerical Error
description: Mork decides to become a priest.

title: Invasion of the Mork Snatchers
description: Mork becomes so hopelessly addicted to advertisements that they invade his dreams.

title: The Way Mork Were
description: Fred confesses that he's having marital difficulties, so Mork and Mindy relay stories of their troubled times.

title: Putting the Ork Back in Mork: Part 1
description: Mindy becomes so alarmed when Mork starts behaving like a boring Earthling that she suggests he finds a new place to live.

title: Putting the Ork Back in Mork: Part 2
description: An Orkan elder arrives and attempts to make Mork revert to his Orkan ways.

title: Mork in Never-Never Land
description: Mork befriends a mental patient who claims to be Peter Pan. Meanwhile, Mindy anxiously awaits word of whether or not she's received a college scholarship.

title: Dueling Skates
description: When Wheels, the owner of the daycare center, announces plans to level the building, Mork challenges him to a skate-off through the city of Boulder.

title: Mork the Prankster
description: After Mindy introduces Mork to the concept of practical jokes, he puts her jeep in their second-floor apartment. Meanwhile, Mindy discovers Glenda Faye is feeling lonely and unhappy.

title: Mork, the Monkey's Uncle
description: Mork takes in a chimp after the chimp's mother goes missing.

title: Gunfight at the Mor-Kay Corral
description: A boy at Mork's day-care center becomes obsessed with Billy the Kid.

title: Mork's New Look
description: Mork goes to see a plastic surgeon.

title: Alas, Poor Mork, We Knew Him Well
description: Mork becomes so paranoid about natural disasters that he locks himself inside a glass bubble.

title: Mork and the Bum Rap
description: Mork becomes a bum in order to help Mindy open a children's hospital.

title: Mindy Gets Her Job
description: Mindy gets a job at a local news station.

title: Twelve Angry Appliances
description: Mork gets revenge when a disrespectful repairman refuses to fix Mindy's stereo.

title: There's a New Mork in Town
description: An Orkan comes down to Earth in order to challenge Mork.

title: Mork Meets Robin Williams
description: Mindy brings home a record of Robin Williams' "Reality,What A Concept" and she then notices that Mork greatly resembles the comedian on the album cover. Mork doesn't see it but people in Boulder,Colorado do because they think he "is" Robin. Robin happens to be coming to Boulder for a live show and Mork is nearly trampled by crazed fans. Mindy gets to interview Robin and brings Mork with her.

title: Mindy, Mindy, Mindy
description: Mork attempts at creating clones of Mindy when she goes out of town.

title: Mork the Swinging Single
description: Mork becomes a swinger after Mindy suggests he see other single women.

title: Mork and Mindy Meet Rick and Ruby
description: Mindy leads a picket line on Remo's restaurant after he fires an unsuccessful singing duo.

title: Mork and the Family Reunion
description: Fred's estranged brother comes into town for a family reunion, but what happens when Mindy eats an Orkan dessert the night of the reunion?

title: Old Muggable Mork
description: When Mindy's grandmother comes to visit, she is mugged, so Mork disguises himself as an old lady to catch the muggers.

title: I Heard It Through the Morkvine
description: Mork goes on television and gives some tasty but hurtful rumors about his friends.

title: Mindy and Mork
description: Mindy has to work late hours on a new TV call-in show, "Talk to Dr. Lincoln", so she asks Mork to help with the housework. When his cleaning efforts turn the apartment into a disaster area, he calls Mindy on the air for advice and nearly gets her fired. When Mindy asks Dr. Lincoln for advice on how to help Mork adjust better to her working, Dr. Lincoln suggests they do a role reversal exercise - so they switch places.

title: Reflections and Regrets
description: On Mr. Bickley's fiftieth birthday, Mindy refuses to share her regret with everyone else as it's too personal.

title: Limited Engagement
description: Mork proposes to Mindy.

title: The Wedding
description: Against direct orders from Orson, Mork goes ahead with his plan to marry Mindy.

title: The Honeymoon
description: Mindy attracts a lot of Orkans when she and Mork spend their honeymoon on his home planet.

title: Three the Hard Way
description: Mork discovers he's pregnant after he and Mindy return from their honeymoon.

title: Mama Mork, Papa Mindy
description: The newborn Mearth seems to show more affection for Mork than for Mindy.

title: My Dad Can't Beat Up Anybody
description: Mork pretends to be a superhero for Mearth's sake.

title: Long Before We Met
description: Mork fantasizes about competing for Mindy in high school.

title: Rich Mork, Poor Mork
description: Mork makes an investment in a boutique of Exidor "originals".

title: Alienation
description: Mearth runs away upon realizing he's an alien.

title: P.S. 2001
description: Mearth attends school on Ork where he's teased for being an "Earth-head".

title: Pajama Game II
description: Mearth has a sleepover.

title: Present Tense
description: Mork and Mindy are unable to have a conversation while Mearth is away.

title: Metamorphosis - The TV Show
description: A short circuit causes Mork and Mearth to switch minds.

title: Drive, She Said
description: Mork takes driving lessons.

title: I Don't Remember Mama
description: Orson erases Mork's family from Mork's memory in order for Mork to focus on his work.

title: Mork, Mindy, and Mearth Meet MILT
description: Following a brief visit from a space traveler, Mork builds a home computer that subsequently takes over.

title: Midas Mork
description: Mork learns the secret of turning polyester into gold.

title: Cheerleader in Chains
description: Mindy is held in contempt of court for refusing to reveal a source of news.

title: Gotta Run: Part 1
description: Mork befriends a Neptunian who has an Earth wife of his own.

title: Gotta Run: Part 2
description: In attempt to stop Kalnik, Mork decides to tell the world he's an alien.

title: Gotta Run: Part 3
description: As a result of his notoriety, Mork is faced with fans, marketing executives and Kalnik.

title: The Mork Report
description: In this episode originally scheduled as 4.19 (before the three-part series finale; instead it aired afterwards), Mork plays TV reporter to Orson, detailing in short sketches how he and Mearth have adjusted to life with Mindy on earth. Mork gets a promotion at the end. Well-directed by Robin Williams, his only known credit as director.
